publicationstmt.date: Online finding aid last updated 11 August 2017.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-08-11T11:30-0700

did.abstract: Betsy Calloway was the principal owner and operator of Maud Gonne Press, a feminist publisher and press operating throughout the 1970s. The press was named after Maud Gonne, an Irish revolutionary, feminist and actress. This collection contains personal correspondence from Betsy Calloway but the majority of the material focuses on her graphic design and printing business. Examples of the work, correspondence between clients and catalogs of comparable services serving the lesbian feminist community are included.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance through out electronic paging system using the "Request items" button.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance through out electronic paging system using the "Request items" button.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Betsy Calloway papers (Collection 2164). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW) and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: Description enhanced and further physical processing completed by Jessica Tai in 2017.
This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW) and the UCLA Library.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Betsy Calloway was the principal owner and operator of Maud Gonne Press. Maud Gonne Press was a feminist publisher and press operating throughout the 1970s. The press was named after Maud Gonne, an Irish revolutionary, feminist and actress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains material relating to Betsy Calloway's graphic design and printing business, Maud Gonne Press. Work examples, correspondence between clients, and catalogs of comparable services serving the lesbian feminist community are represented. Also contained is ephemera from women's literary and feminist events, newsletters and business activity.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged categorically and further arranged chronologically.

controlaccess.corpname: June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA.
controlaccess.subject: Lesbian business enterprises--Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Betsy Calloway and friends.

did.physdesc: typewritten paper, printed paper, handwritten letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters from organizations with which Betsy Calloway worked in some capacity. Some fundraising letters and some action oriented correspondence.

did.unittitle: Maud Gonne Press: bills and invoices

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bills and invoices for Maud Gonne Press daily operations and specific projects.

did.unittitle: Maud Gonne Press: correspondence and ephemera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and letters of inquiry about potential projects for Maud Gonne Press.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Examples of the work done by Maud Gonne Press including business cards, letterhead, stationary, flyers, and brochures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalogs for feminist presses and products.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, papers and newsletters including materials from the National Gay Caucus, Charagos, Lavender University and the Berkeley and Oakland Women's Union.
